channel.title: Could this laptop handle any games?
channel.description:
Hello,
I wanted a laptop for traveling as I already have a main pc, could this laptop handle some pc games?
http://h10010.www1.hp.com/wwpc/uk/en/ho/WF06b/321957-321957-3329744-64354-64354-3672909-3753641.html
it's got 3gb of ram 250gb hard drive.
Ok,
If it wouldn't would it if:
I added 1 more gig of ram, and 64bit.
Thanks

item.title: Could this laptop handle any games?
item.dc:creator: @FloStateKid FloStateKid
item.description:
@FloStateKid wrote:

[quote=“I james I, post:22, topic:238508”][quote author=minnergod1 link=topic=314775.msg2507285#msg2507285 date=1224990039]
ya it’ll hold cod5 and counterstrike i have both on mine and mine runs perfectly and u want the same one i have so… ya it’ll work
[/quote]

LOL, cod5 isnt even released yet lmao?[/quote]

owned…

Read full topic
item.source: Could this laptop handle any games?

item.title: Could this laptop handle any games?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Tico135:

It’s more then likely you can find a laptop with better specs, and for a much cheaper price. By the looks of it you wouldn’t be able to run games well, so I’d stick to anything with a graphics card of NVIDIA GeForce 8200M or above.

That laptop is fail, probably an Intel chip, your right.

Read full topic

item.title: Could this laptop handle any games?
item.dc:creator: @I_james_I I james I
item.description:
@I_james_I wrote:

[quote=“bigh51, post:16, topic:238508”][quote author=I james I link=topic=314775.msg2505998#msg2505998 date=1224921792]

[quote author=bigh51 link=topic=314775.msg2504659#msg2504659 date=1224871686]

It’s more then likely you can find a laptop with better specs, and for a much cheaper price. By the looks of it you wouldn’t be able to run games well, so I’d stick to anything with a graphics card of NVIDIA GeForce 8200M or above.
[/quote]I didn’t even know there was an 8200M. I would recommend 8600M+, although I don’t even use my computer for gaming anymore.

Yes, but what I mean is, is that possible to put in a laptop?
[/quote]You don’t “put” it in a laptop unless you’re building a custom one which you’re not. You can buy prebuilt ones with an 8600M+, although ps3/360 are better for gaming IMO.[/quote]

Yes, I have an xbox360 :\

Read full topic
item.source: Could this laptop handle any games?

item.title: Could this laptop handle any games?
item.dc:creator: @I_james_I I james I
item.description:
@I_james_I wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:10, topic:238508”]The laptop you said is internal graphics, and they just tried making it sound better with the extra memory, don’t listen to that shit. If it’s not nvidia or ATi its shit.

It won’t run COD5

it will run cs 1.6
it will probably just run cs:s at very low details and still may be laggyy.

That is not your gaming laptop, but put the NVIDIA® GeForce™ 8400M GS Video Adapter and it should be average and run the things you need in a low-medium detail.[/quote]

could i put: NVIDIA® GeForce™ 8400M GS Video Adapter

Inside it?

Read full topic
item.source: Could this laptop handle any games?

item.title: Could this laptop handle any games?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

The laptop you said is internal graphics, and they just tried making it sound better with the extra memory, don’t listen to that shit. If it’s not nvidia or ATi its shit.

It won’t run COD5

it will run cs 1.6
it will probably just run cs:s at very low details and still may be laggyy.

That is not your gaming laptop, but put the NVIDIA® GeForce™ 8400M GS Video Adapter and it should be average and run the things you need in a low-medium detail.

Read full topic
item.source: Could this laptop handle any games?

item.description:
@I_james_I wrote:

[quote=“Rog3r, post:8, topic:238508”][quote author=I james I link=topic=314775.msg2502835#msg2502835 date=1224788824]
Hello,

I wanted a laptop for traveling as I already have a main pc, could this laptop handle some pc games?

http://h10010.www1.hp.com/wwpc/uk/en/ho/WF06b/321957-321957-3329744-64354-64354-3672909-3753641.html

it’s got 3gb of ram 250gb hard drive.

Ok,

If it wouldn’t would it if:

I added 1 more gig of ram, and 64bit.

Thanks
[/quote]

Why not try it out for yourself and see if it works?[/quote]

Because i dont have laptop yet, and if i buy it might no play the games.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 24, 2008, 07:40:42 am[/size][hr][quote=“pk4pk, post:4, topic:238508”][quote author=I james I link=topic=314775.msg2502838#msg2502838 date=1224789043]
i wana get cod5, and counterstrike thats it. where can i find out needed specs
[/quote]
Get a laptop with 1.5gb + and geforce 8800

That should handle pretty much everything. Unless your running vista then you want

2gigs+[/quote]

this?

Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce™ 8400M GS Video Adapter

Read full topic

item.title: Could this laptop handle any games?
item.dc:creator: @belbn belbn
item.description:
@belbn wrote:

I james I:

i wana get cod5, and counterstrike thats it. where can i find out needed specs

COD5 specs:
Processor: AMD 64 3200+/Intel Pentium 4 3.0GHz or better
Memory: 8 GB free hard-drive space, 512MB RAM (XP)/1GB RAM (Vista)
Graphics: Shader 3.0 or better, 256MB Nvidia GeForce 6600GT/ATI Radeon 1600XT or better

Counterstrike: graphics suck anyway so there are no requirements.

Read full topic
item.source: Could this laptop handle any games?
